segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and she looks so calm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing, and I’m surprised she hasn’t noticed it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is reaching for the cookies, and I’m surprised he hasn’t fallen yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is wobbling, and I’m surprised the girl isn’t trying to help him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman would be surprised if she turned around and saw what was happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is making a mess, and I’m surprised no one has slipped yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on the cookies, and I’m surprised he hasn’t been caught yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman is so unaware of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is full of surprises.
segments.speaker: PAR
